comment: Kind guy, trying his best to teach, but could teach material better. Seems to be distracted and have a lot on his plate. His understanding of lab procedures could be improved as there were times where he gave false or misleading instructions. Would try to find other teachers over him.
Kinda confused at the rating. He is a good teacher, he makes it hard to fail as long as you show up and do the work you will get a good grade.

I had him at KSU and heard he's gotten some recent hate. He's the kindest lab professor I've had and helps with worksheets. If it's a hard lab and he's solo, I get the ratings—but with a TA, he does great. He's efficient and doesn't waste time. However, maybe it's just that I'm patient and had good support.

(Chem204 @ Emory) Dr Matt is a nice guy. He's teaching at three different schools and is spread thin. That being said, he can't teach to save his life. He doesn't understand the material of the class himself. He's convinced his averages are so bad bc the students are lazy. His learning objectives aren't clear. I'm not a fan :(

Dr. Matt is a great lab professor. If you read the procedure carefully and follow directions, you'll usually finish early (rare for chem labs). He's fun, laid back, and doesn't pressure you to be perfect. Very understanding and creates a stress-free learning environment. I'd highly recommend Dr. Matt for Orgo labs at KSU.

This guy is teaching at three different universities so spreads himself extremely thin, and frequently blames students for any misunderstandings in content, material, or class expectations unspecified in syllabus. He will destroy a grade over proper formatting/justification without primarily considering the content of lab papers. Not a fan.

(CHEM204 @Emory) I honestly think he's a nice guy who cares about his students, but his teaching ability and exams don't reflect it. Uses another profs slides and doesn't explain things clearly or in-depth. Exams have content that students have never been shown on any worksheets, hws, practice exams etc.  Hoping to make it through the sem alive lol

(Chem 204) btw. I am a junior and have never done a rate my professor. I am six semesters and two summer terms into college and have experienced some actual BS, but this... ts is genuinely my worst college experience. Doesn't know how to teach. Exams are stuff we've never seen in our lives. Blames US for failing averages. RUNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNNN

(EMORY CHEM 204) Oh boy oh boy where do I start. This guy doesn't teach the material and expects us to know everything backwards and forwards.  He believes grades don't matter but gives everyone failing grades. I feel bad because it is more of Emory's fault as they have created an environment where the professor one takes determines your gpa.

Matthew is kind and funny,but his grading is inconsistent and unfair. He bases grades on comparisons to other students rather than the actual prompt, penalizing those who follow instructions.Theres no clear rubric, and his feedback is unhelpful,offering little guidance for improvement. If you need constructive feedback this class is frustrating

(CHEM204 at Emory) Run. Used another professor's exams and then was surprised when there was a near-failing average. Lectures are useless. Tries to explain things using shortcuts but ends up missing key concepts. Office hours just cause more confusion. A nice guy who cares, but he will not set you up for success.

Never again. I got a lower grade in this lab than I did in the lecture. He was condescending and gave very little, completely useless feedback on lab reports. He did not pay attention to what was happening, leading to multiple minor accidents that could have been far more dangerous. He makes students stay the whole time for dry labs. Avoid!

He is a funny guy! Overall, this is a pretty simple lab, but he still does a great job explaining the procedures and whatnot. He answers questions thoughtfully and isn't rude at all. From what I have seen, he gives good feedback on assignments and is not a tough grader. He answers emails pretty quickly. Good prof for lab I would def take him again.
